p: In all previously described experiments, the products of amplification from both thermocyclers were primarily detected on agarose gels using conventional electrophoresis techniques conducted with conventional lab equipment. However, as previously mentioned, the miniPCR system is commercialized with its own “blueGel” electrophoretic unit ( Fig 5A). In a last set of experiments, we separated the amplification products using the miniPCR electrophoretic unit to assess its practicality and reliability. Fig 5B shows a gel that displays the products of amplification of a typical experiment where EBOV sequences were targeted.
